page.title: 05DAVID BROWN INDUSTRIES
page.content: The{David Brown Company}first started on{Vulcan St Huddersfield 1860.}The person who owns the factory is now{Sir {David Brown.}They made{wooden gear {patterns.}They wanted to{expand}so they moved to{Lockwood.}They moved to Lockwood because it was near a{railway {station,a main road}& also because there was{alot of space.}This all happened in{1902.}It was only a{small {company}but now it is{very big.}It is {65000sq/m in area.}They make{metal {gears}now. The{smallest}gears are{10cm {long}& the{largest}are{40sq/m.}There are{93 women}employed &{1356 people altogether. Many of the them work {overtime}because there are{alot of {orders}at the moment.There are{less people working there than{4yrs}ago. Goods are sold to{Europe,America, Asia {& Australia.
